meanings.definition: Lacking a tail or tail-like appendage.
meanings.sent1: The lizard was excaudate, with no tail to be seen.
meanings.sent2: The bird had an excaudate appearance, unlike its feathered friends.
meanings.sent3: The excaudate squirrel tried to balance on the branch, but kept slipping off.
meanings.sent4: Her excaudate hair, cut short, gave her a unique and modern look.
meanings.sent5: The excaudate fish swam gracefully through the water, its streamlined body a marvel to behold.

meanings.definition: To remove or cut off a tail or tail-like appendage.
meanings.sent1: The veterinarian had to excaudate the injured cat to prevent infection.
meanings.sent2: The gardener decided to excaudate the bush to promote new growth.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally excaudated the ribbon while wrapping the gift, making it too short.
meanings.sent4: The tailor had to excaudate the fabric to adjust the length of the dress.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully excaudated the shrimp before cooking, ensuring a clean presentation.
